content.description: Two runners, A and B, run on a straight racetrack for  <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C86@</annotation> </semantics> </math> seconds. The graph above, which consists of two line segments. shows the velocity, in meters per second, of Runner A. The velocity, in meters per second, of Runner B is given by the function v defined by v(t) = <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>24</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BCB@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
content.question: Find the acceleration of Runner A and the acceleration of Runner B at time t = 2 seconds. Indicate the units of measure.

frqParts.text: Find the acceleration of Runner A and the acceleration of Runner B at time t = 2 seconds. Indicate the units of measure.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
